articles.author: Amala Balakrishner
articles.title: Asia-Pacific markets track Wall Street gains as Trump pushes for rate cuts - CNBC
articles.description: The Bank of Japan hiked rates by 25 basis points to 0.5%, their highest level since 2008.
articles.content:
Asia-Pacific markets climbed Friday, after the S&P 500 hit record highs overnight as U.S. President Donald Trump called for lower interest rates and cheaper oil prices.
